{{also|市內}}
==Chinese==
{{zh-see|市內}}

----

==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|し|ない|yomi=on}}

===Etymology===
From {{der|ja|ltc|sort=しない|-}} compound {{m|zh|市內|tr={{IPAchar|/d͡ʑɨ<sup>X</sup> nuʌi<sup>H</sup>/}}|lit=city, town + inside, interior}}.  Compare modern {{cog|cmn|市內}} reading ''shìnèi'', {{cog|yue|-}} ''si<sup>5</sup> noi<sup>6</sup>''.

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|yomi=o|しない|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR,NHK}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|しない|kyu=市內}}

# the {{l|en|interior}} of a {{l|en|city}}
#: {{ja-usex|'''市内'''に住んでいる。|'''しない''' に すんで いる。|I live in the '''interior of the city''' → I live '''in the city'''.}}

====Usage notes====
Sometimes glossed in English as adjectives {{m|en|local}} or {{m|en|intracity}}.  However, it is important to note that the Japanese term is a noun, not an adjective.  When used to modify another noun, {{lang|ja|市内}} either takes the possessive partcile {{m|ja|の|tr=no}} as in {{lang|ja|市内}}{{m|ja|の}}{{m|ja|学校|tr=shinai no gakkō||intracity schools, the schools in a city}}, or it is prefixed directly in a compound, as in {{m|ja|市内電車|tr=shinai densha||tram, streetcar|lit=municipal or intracity train}}.
